## parseJson() function

Convert a JSON string into an object.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function parseJson<T = any>(input: string, reviver?: (this: any, key: string, value: any) => any): T;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

input


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The JSON string to parse.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

reviver


</td><td>

(this: any, key: string, value: any) =&gt; any


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ A function that transforms the results.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

T

## Exceptions

SyntaxError - If `input` is not valid JSON.

## Remarks

The purpose of this function is simply to allow type inference. At runtime this is synonymous with calling \[`JSON.parse`<!-- -->\](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global\_Objects/JSON/parse).

## Example


```ts
interface Model {
    foo: string;
}

const parsed = parseJson<Model>('{"foo":"bar"}');
```
